meanings.sent1: The plant's autogenously grown leaves were vibrant and healthy.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the autogenously formed crystals under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The robot claimed to have autogenously repaired itself overnight, much to the surprise of its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity seemed to flow autogenously, without any external influence.
meanings.sent5: The idea for the painting came to her autogenously, as if from within her soul.

meanings.sent1: The autogenously pollinating flowers in the garden amazed the botanist.
meanings.sent2: Certain fish species are known to be autogenously reproductive.
meanings.sent3: The farmer joked that the self-pollinating plants were autogenously independent.
meanings.sent4: The concept of self-sustainability can be seen as autogenously empowering.
meanings.sent5: The ability to reproduce autogenously is a unique trait in some organisms.

meanings.sent1: The autogenously healing process of the body amazed the doctors.
meanings.sent2: The immune system works autogenously to fight off infections.
meanings.sent3: The idea of self-repairing robots seemed almost autogenously futuristic.
meanings.sent4: Her strength came autogenously from her own determination and resilience.
meanings.sent5: The plant's ability to regenerate autogenously after being damaged was truly remarkable.
